page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: TRANSPORT PLAYS A BIG ROLE IN THE EVERYDAY LIFE OF ALL INHABITANTS. HORSFORD'S GROWTH AND SHAPE IS LARGELY DUE TO THE INCREASE IN OWNERSHIP OF MOTOR CARS. THE B1149 IS BUSY AT MOST TIMES BUT ESPECIALLY DURING THE COMMUTER PERIODS; 8-9am. AND 4.30 - 5.30pm. ADULTS ARE THEN TRAVELLING TO WORK AND CHILDREN TO SCHOOL. HORSFORD CHILDREN WALK, WHILE ST. FAITHS AND FELTHORPE ARE BUSED TO SCHOOL.CARS ARE THE MOST COMMON FORM OF TRANSPORT, THOUGH MANY LORRIES CAN BE SEEN ON DELIVERY JOURNEYS DURING THE DAY. THE BICYCLE IS POPULAR FOR LOCAL TRANSPORT AND USED BY THE ENTHUSIAST FOR LONGER JOURNEYS... NORWICH AND BEYOND. THE MOTOR CYCLE CAN BE SEEN OFTEN, THOUGH IT IS FAR LESS POPULAR. WALKERS ARE EITHER LOCAL, OR RECREATIONAL. RESIDENTIAL CLOSES ARE VERY QUIET AND FEW VEHICLES ARE SEEN ALONG THEM.
